summary: This document is an FBI operational travel plan detailing the deployment of personnel to St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, in August 2019 to execute a search warrant, likely on Jeffrey Epstein's private island (Little St. James). It outlines a multi-day schedule for agents, tactical teams, and support staff to travel, prepare, and conduct the search operation.

events.title: Advance Team Travel to St. Thomas
events.description: RDT POCs and case agents travel to St. Thomas for advance planning and to swear out a warrant.

events.title: Crisis Management Team Arrival
events.description: SSA and SA from Crisis Management travel to St. Thomas to join the advance team and assist with RDT/ERT preparation.

events.title: Main Team Deployment to St. Thomas
events.description: A large FBI team of approximately 43 personnel, including ERT, case squad, CART, SWAT, and paramedics, travel to St. Thomas on an FBI aircraft.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant
events.description: The planned search operation is executed. An additional SA flies to St. Thomas to join the search team.

events.title: Search Continues
events.description: The search operation continues for a second day.

events.title: Search Concludes and Team Departs
events.description: The search operation is anticipated to be wrapped up, and the entire team is scheduled to depart.

locations: Epstein Island (Little St. James, inferred from document title)
keyFacts: The FBI planned and executed a major multi-day search operation on 'Epstein Island' in August 2019.
The operation involved a large, coordinated team of over 40 personnel including Evidence Response Teams (ERT), case agents, SWAT, and medical support.
The plan involved advance teams traveling days before the main search to prepare and swear out the warrant.
The operational timeline spanned from August 8 to August 14, 2019, with the main search executed on August 12.
The document title explicitly names 'Epstein Island,' directly linking the operation to properties owned by Jeffrey Epstein.
